# Antigravity Mover

**Antigravity Mover** is a productivity extension designed to streamline your workflow when using **Antigravity AI**. It automatically detects new image assets generated by Antigravity and moves them directly into your current VS Code workspace.

## Features

- ğŸš€ **Auto-Detection**: Monitors the `~/.gemini/antigravity/brain` directory for new images.
- ğŸ“‚ **Auto-Move**: Automatically copies new images to your project folder.
- âš™ï¸ **Configurable**: 
    - Enable/Disable the mover.
    - Customize the destination folder (default: `.antigravity-images`).

## Usage

1. Install the extension.
2. Open a project in VS Code.
3. Generate an image using Antigravity.
4. The image will appear in your project's `.antigravity-images` folder automatically!

## Configuration

You can configure the following settings in VS Code (`Command` + `,`):

- `antigravityMover.enable`: Enable or disable the extension (default: `true`).
- `antigravityMover.destinationFolder`: The specific folder name to save images (default: `.antigravity-images`).

## Requirements

- Antigravity AI installed and running.

## Feedback & Support

If you have any issues or feature requests, please file a bug report on our [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/maximalcode/antigravity-mover).
